title: What XD Really Means in the Digital World

steps.title: XD is an older emoticon that means â€œlaughing out loud.â€
steps.content: XD is an older emoticon that means â€œlaughing out loud.â€ Nowadays, we tap on emojis like ğŸ˜‚ (face with tears of joy emoji), ğŸ˜† (grinning squinting face emoji), and ğŸ¤£ (rolling on the floor laughing emoji) when we find something funny or are trying to lighten the mood. Back in the 2000s, though, this wide selection of emojis was nonexistentâ€”so, netizens would improvise by sending an XD emoticon that resembled a laughing face with squinting eyes rotated to the left, like the ğŸ˜† (grinning squinting face emoji). Think of it like as a digital synonym for slang like LOL , hehe , and haha . [1] X Research source â€œI think I passed my first grade teacher in Walmart XDâ€ â€œThatâ€™s so funny!! I still canâ€™t believe you did that XDâ€ Some netizens choose to use variations of the emoticon, like xD or xd. Both of these still mean the same thing! Did you know? XD means the same thing across all digital platforms. In most cases, XD is just another way to add a light-hearted vibe to a message, whether itâ€™s over email, text, or social media. It even means the same thing on gaming platforms like Roblox â€”users use XD as a way to react to something funny.

steps.title: Express how funny something is with XD.
steps.content: Express how funny something is with XD. Find a hilarious meme online, or canâ€™t contain your laughter in the middle of a digital convo? Use XD to show just how tickled you are (without even having to touch your emoji keyboard). [2] X Research source â€œThis is the best thing Iâ€™ve seen all week XDâ€ â€œThis is amazing XD how did you pull off that prank without your brother noticing???â€

steps.title: Add a friendly, humorous touch to your message.
steps.content: Add a friendly, humorous touch to your message. Emojis and emoticons definitely arenâ€™t for everyone, but some people like to add an extra â€œoomphâ€ of friendliness and cheer to their messages. If youâ€™re worried that message might come across as a bit stale or cold, add an XD into the mix to the let the other person know that everything is good. steps.title: Reply with a cheerful emoji or emoticon if the convo calls for it.
steps.content: Reply with a cheerful emoji or emoticon if the convo calls for it. There are no hard and fast rules when it comes to replying to messages with XD in themâ€”it really depends on what was sent originally (and if you feel like replying in the first place). Feel free to drop an LOL, XD, or other cheerful emoji in response, or reply in whatever way feels most comfortable and authentic to you. Them: â€œHow can you stand working 12-hour shifts? I would be bouncing off the walls XDâ€ You: â€œIâ€™m just built different I guess ğŸ˜‚â€ Them: â€œAre you still bringing some of your momâ€™s guac to my party tomorrow? XDâ€ You: â€œI know youâ€™d give me the silent treatment if I didnâ€™t. XDâ€

steps.title: I Love You
steps.content: I Love You XD really planted its roots in the emo community in 2004 when a digital artist posted a cartoon dinosaur named OMG RAWR XDâ€ and captioned it with â€œRawr! It means â€œI love you!â€ in dinosaur.â€ This lingo became especially prominent within meme culture in the mid-2010s, when social media users began roasting â€œRawr XDâ€ as cringy way that emo individuals said â€œI love youâ€ (based on stereotypes). [4] X Research source Person 1: â€œRawr XDâ€ Person 2: â€œYou did not just send me that LOLâ€ This meaning of the emoticon is more ironic than anything else. If someone says â€œRawr XDâ€ in this day and age, theyâ€™re probably referencing this meme.

steps.title: Extreme Digital

Cinemark XD theaters offer features like 35 trillion on-screen colors, 50,000 watts of audio, and a giant screen thatâ€™s as tall as a 6-story building. steps.title: Kissed
steps.content: Kissed On rare occasions, someone might send XD as a way of saying â€œkissed,â€ based on the age-old abbreviation of Xs and Os symbolizing kisses and hugs, respectively. Nowadays, though, people are much likely to just send a ğŸ˜˜ (face blowing a kiss emoji), ğŸ’‹ (kiss mark emoji), ğŸ˜— (kissing face emoji), and ğŸ’ (kiss emoji) if theyâ€™re trying to share any kiss-worthy sentiments. â€œI totally XD him last nightâ€ XD also rarely stands for â€œcrossed,â€ with X representing the cross and â€œDâ€ representing the â€œedâ€ ending of the word.
